abstract: The Economist says there is a steady rise in investment in Africa, with banks pushing into countries where they once feared to tread.
snippet: The Economist says there is a steady rise in investment in Africa, with banks pushing into countries where they once feared to tread.
lead_paragraph: “Now everyone’s looking at Africa,” Jacko Maree, the boss of Standard Bank, South Africa’s biggest lender, told The Economist in an article detailing the steady rise in investment on the continent.

headline.main: Into Africa: Banks Expand South of Sahara
